verses.verse: (A Psalm, a Song for the Sabbath day.) It is <S%H2896>good<s%> to <S%H3034>give<s%> <S%H3034>thanks<s%> to the <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> And to <S%H2167>sing<s%> <S%H2167>praises<s%> to Thy <S%H8034>name,<s%> O <S%H9411>Most<s%> <S%H9411>High;<s%>
To <S%H5046>declare<s%> Thy <S%H2617>lovingkindness<s%> in the <S%H1242>morning,<s%> And Thy <S%H530>faithfulness<s%> by <S%H3915>night,<s%>
With the ten-stringed lute, and with the <S%H5035>harp;<s%> With <S%H1902>resounding<s%> <S%H1902>music<s%> upon the <S%H3658>lyre.<s%>

For Thou, O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> hast <S%H8055>made<s%> me <S%H8055>glad<s%> by <S%H6467>what<s%> Thou hast <S%H6467>done,<s%> I will <S%H7442>sing<s%> for <S%H7442>joy<s%> at the <S%H4639>works<s%> of Thy <S%H3027>hands.<s%>

That when the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H6524>sprouted<s%> up <S%H3644>like<s%> <S%H6212>grass,<s%> And <S%H3605>all<s%> who <S%H6466>did<s%> <S%H205>iniquity<s%> <S%H6692>flourished,<s%> It [was only] that they might be <S%H8045>destroyed<s%> <S%H5704>forevermore.<s%> <S%H5703><s%>

For, <S%H2009>behold,<s%> Thine <S%H340>enemies,<s%> O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> For, <S%H2009>behold,<s%> Thine <S%H340>enemies<s%> will perish; <S%H6>All<s%> who <S%H3605>do<s%> <S%H6466>iniquity<s%> will be <S%H205>scattered.<s%>
But Thou hast <S%H7311>exalted<s%> my <S%H7161>horn<s%> like [that of] the <S%H7214>wild<s%> <S%H7214>ox;<s%> I have been <S%H1101>anointed<s%> with <S%H7488>fresh<s%> <S%H8081>oil.<s%>

And my <S%H5869>eye<s%> has <S%H5027>looked<s%> [exultantly] upon my <S%H7790>foes,<s%> My <S%H241>ears<s%> <S%H8085>hear<s%> of the <S%H7489>evildoers<s%> who <S%H6965>rise<s%> up <S%H5921>against<s%> me.
The <S%H6662>righteous<s%> <S%H6662>man<s%> will <S%H6524>flourish<s%> like the <S%H8558>palm<s%> <S%H8558>tree,<s%> He will <S%H7685>grow<s%> like a <S%H730>cedar<s%> in <S%H3844>Lebanon.<s%>
<S%H8362>Planted<s%> in the <S%H1004>house<s%> of the <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> They will <S%H6524>flourish<s%> in the <S%H2691>courts<s%> of our <S%H430>God.<s%>
They will <S%H5750>still<s%> <S%H5107>yield<s%> <S%H5107>fruit<s%> in <S%H7872>old<s%> <S%H7872>age;<s%> They shall be <S%H1879>full<s%> of <S%H1879>sap<s%> and <S%H7488>very<s%> <S%H7488>green,<s%>
To <S%H5046>declare<s%> that the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> is <S%H3477>upright;<s%> [He is] my <S%H6697>rock,<s%> and there is <S%H3808>no<s%> <S%H9390>unrighteousness<s%> in Him.
